title: Prefigurative Community Building (Part 6): Cooking Together is Revolutionary - Neighborhood Food Circles
summary: How to start a Neighborhood Food Circle as a Power With project. A guide to creating rotating meal shares that build community, reduce costs, and practice collective care through shared cooking.

Food.summary: Create rotating meal shares that reduce costs while building community through shared cooking.

level0: Start with one conversation among 3-6 trusted neighbors
Design agreements together using consensus-based decisions
level1: Choose coordination method without hierarchy (shared calendar, group chat)
Start sharing meals through rotation or potlucks
level2: Make sharing mutual rather than measured - let people contribute how they can
Partner with community gardens or grow food together
level3: Expand gently through personal connection to new members
Offer meal shares to elders, new parents, or neighbors in need

Community.summary: Build relationships and mutual trust through the ritual of shared meals.

level0: Practice consensus decision-making around food preferences and scheduling
level1: Rotate communication duties and avoid having a 'coordinator'
Create flexible roles that people can opt into
level2: Build culture where people can skip weeks without guilt or judgment
Develop shared rituals around meal preparation and eating
level3: Create permanent food-sharing infrastructure that supports community resilience

Knowledge.summary: Learn cooking skills while practicing horizontal organizing and mutual aid.

level0: Share recipes and cooking techniques informally
Learn consensus decision-making through food planning
level1: Develop skills in group facilitation and conflict resolution
Practice cultural exchange through diverse food traditions
level2: Teach others how to start food circles
Learn about food justice and cooperative economics
level3: Become resource for community cooking and food sharing projects
Train others in mutual aid organizing through food

Narrative.summary: Transform understanding of food from individual consumption to collective nourishment.

level0: Practice seeing meals as sites of connection rather than just consumption
level1: Share stories about how food brings people together
Challenge individualistic approaches to daily needs
level2: Help others understand food sharing as resistance to capitalism
Model how abundance is created through cooperation
level3: Transform community culture around food from scarcity to abundance
Build widespread understanding of food as collective good
